sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
A declaration of the tender mercies of the living Lord in causing his holy day to spring from on high, in this our age and generation, after a long night of darkness, that for many ages hath covered the earth and people. With a few words, from my own experience, of what I have found and tasted of the goodness of God in that way of the professors to the world esteem dangerous and erroneous; with a testimony, that it is the path of life, although such as are in the snares of death cannot ponder it, until they come to the light that leads to it. Wollrich, Humphry, 1633?-1707.
12 p.
s.n., [London : 1670?]
Caption title. Imprint from Wing. Signed at end by Humphrey Wolrich. Includes one line of errata. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======
